fields.description:
It seems to be a problem on using user defined macros in flow text.

Use Case:
* Open a site for editing
* Embed a user defined macro in flow text
* Save the site
* Open the site for editing again. 

Failure: The flow text is broken at the place of macro: before and after the macro two linebreakes are inserted.

For macrodefinition see screenshot. It defines a simple link to a jira ticket for using in flowtext. 

This bug makes this sort of user defined macros unusable.
fields.summary: Failure on using user defined macros in flow text

fields.description:
The DefaultSpaceManager's removeSpace method:
* removes a space
* adds an "unindex" task for the space
* flushes the index queue
* makes additional changes to the database

The transaction is then committed afterwards.  There are two major problems with this:
1. If the transaction is rolled back due to some failure, the index will still be missing the entries for the space, and they will not be re-added.
2. A deadlock can occur on at least DB2 (in currently unsupported high isolation levels). An existing index task gets locked by the database lock from the yet-to-be-committed space removal, and the space removal waits on the indexer's java lock when it tries to invoke the indexer directly.
fields.summary: Removing a space removes the content from the index before the removal is committed to the database

fields.description: The index on the CONTENT.DRAFTSPACEKEY column was named c_draftspacekey_idx.  That name is too long for DB2 and prevents the Confluence database being set up against DB2.

fields.description:
The bit of the filter that is supposed to clean up smart-quotes pasted from Windows 8-bit code-pages also blows away the same characters when they're completely legitimate Unicode. This is a Bad Thing.

An example of this problem would be if you tried to use unicode quotes or dashes in page content then they would be removed when you saved the page.
fields.summary: ConfluenceEncodingFilter removes Unicode dashes, quotes, bullets and ellipses

fields.description:
Not all macros shipped with Confluence are currently documented and customers are having a hard time to learn what plugins are available and how to use them. The Confluence Hosted documentation will soon display a page with installed plugins. Each plugin should point to a page in the Confluence Documentation where customers can learn more about the individual plugins and how to use them. 

Gurleen has created a [list of user-facing plugins|https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/display/CH/Available+Plugins] in Confluence Hosted that point to either existing documentation or should point to a summary page for plugins such as the _advanced macros_ plugin. Existing documentation is linked and non existing documentation is marked as non existing links.
fields.summary: Documentation of core macros in the advanced and basic macros plugins

fields.description:
The recently-updated macro allows you to add more than one label, but applies the OR condition to these labels.  

Our site is setup to use a lot of cross-referencing of labels (one set of labels for region, one set of labels for user type = one of each to filter information) and users have requested to see what has been updated recently, especially, what has been updated recently for their user group (region/user type).  Allowing to choose the operator for the recently-updated macro would help with this.

Thanks!
fields.summary: recently-updated macro should support AND condition with labels

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-11364].
  {panel}

I'd like to be to have multiple {recently-updated} in order to separate recently updated news/blog from pages from discussion/comments. When I try this, the section titles are the same (so an ability to set title would be helpful) and when "view more" function only impacts the first {recently-updated} section even when the "+" is clicked for a different {recently-updated} section. In the example, I'm trying to accomplish this on the dashboard layout.

$helper.renderConfluenceMacro("{recently-updated:dashboard|types=news|showProfilePic=false}") - 10 displayed
$helper.renderConfluenceMacro("{recently-updated:dashboard|types=page,attachment|showProfilePic=false}")  - 10 displayed
$helper.renderConfluenceMacro("{recently-updated:dashboard|types=comment|showProfilePic=false}")  - 10 displayed, click "+" here

Result:
$helper.renderConfluenceMacro("{recently-updated:dashboard|types=news|showProfilePic=false}") - 20 displayed
$helper.renderConfluenceMacro("{recently-updated:dashboard|types=page,attachment|showProfilePic=false}")  - 10 displayed
$helper.renderConfluenceMacro("{recently-updated:dashboard|types=comment|showProfilePic=false}")  - 10 displayed
fields.summary: Multiple instances of {recently-updated} on one page

fields.description:
When you mouseover the icon for a news post that is displayed in the dashboard that the message says

{{User Profile:}}

Reproduction

Add a news post to any space
after posting the news wait a min for the dashboard to update
once you see your news post in the dashboard hover over the icon that represents that news post
observe that when you hover over the icon that the message {{user profile:}} is displayed.

Expected Results: I expected that hovering over the icon would display who posted the news or the title of the news posting.
Actual Results: Actually, when hovering over the icon the message {{user profile:}} is displayed.

Other Information:
In example of other features which share the functionality, when hovering over a a space icon "the earth" in the recently updated section the name of the space is displayed in the tooltip.
fields.summary: The tooltip for a news post image in the recently updated section of dashboard doesn't display who posted the news.

fields.description:
I'm currently writing a Perl module abstraction layer for the Confluence SOAP API.

When using the spacekey "sandbox" and pagetitle "Home" with: 
my $pagetest = $self->{client}->getPage($self->{token}, $spacekey, $pagetitle);
I don't get any result. $pagetest seems to be empty. 

Whereas with getPage($self->{token}, $pageid); using the id of the sandbox Home.. it gets me a correct Page result.

What's wrong? Looks to me as if getPage is broken using spacekey and pagetitle in the request.
A possible workaround would now be to use the search function ... but that's too borked.
fields.summary: getPage(String token, String spaceKey, String pageTitle) seems broken

fields.description:
After running a while Confluence will bail out with "Exception in thread "TP-Processor62" java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: PermGen space". The tomcat instance running Confluence is killed, Confluence is in tune not available any more.

Java is given options "-Xms160m -Xmx2048m", the OS has 3GiByte to run.

Starting tomcat5 again gives no errors and Confluence will run for some time --- until the next out of memory error, bailing out with various "TP-ProcessorNN java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: PermGen space" messages (where NN are numbers from 00 to 99).
fields.summary: Exception in thread "TP-Processor62" java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: PermGen space

fields.description:
Email integration for Confluence could be streamlined alot. One of the key workflows that all users are used to when participating in a comment based conversation is to hold the discussion via the appropriate tool i.e. an email client, a news client, etc. Currently comments and related conversations on pages in Confluence don't flow well, and require careful attention to  keep up to date on.

This improvement request is simple.

* support email replies to comment notifications from a confluence page's comments.
* comments should be notified one by one, and 
* the thread context of the reply should be kept
fields.summary: Page Comments notification - reply to thread via email

fields.description:
This problem was found when a customer upgraded from 1.4.1 to 2.7.2 using an XML site backup {{without}} attachments. The process the customer used involved importing the backup into 2.7.2 and then manually copying the attachments folder across from the Home directory of 1.4.1 to 2.7.2. Everything works fine, except that they could not download any attachments. 
Removing the index directory and re-indexing the entire instance numerous times did not make any difference. 

Clearing the browser cache as a precaution also didn't show any change.

I also examined HTTP headers for the attachment download requests; the http requests are basically the same structure:
/download/attachments/<pageid>/<attachmentname> HTTP 1.1

I tested the problem locally with 1.4.1, creating an XML backup *with* attachments; the problem also occurs. The prime suspect looks to be that the upgrade Task designed to restructure the attachments directory (first implemented in Confluence 2.2) is no longer working. 

The directory structure for attachments in 1.4.1 is as follows:

<Confluence-Home>/attachments/pageID/attachment-name/version

The directory structure as of Confluence 2.2. is:

<Confluence-Home>/attachments/pageID/attachmentID/version

I haven't identified from which version this was actually broken, so we'll need to identify that.
fields.summary: Upgrade Task for Attachment directory restructure broken

fields.description:
Restoring a backup of an older version of Confluence (older than build 1012) will cause the osUserToAtlassianUserMigrationUpgradeTask to be run. The {{OSUEntityMigrator}} used in this class includes embedded SQL which has upper case table and column names. The {{BucketPropertySetItem.hbm.xml}} which defines these tables uses lower case so where the database is case sensitive these queries fail, resulting in a failure of the site import.

This was found during pre-release testing of Confluence 2.8 on SQL Server 2005.
fields.summary: OSUser entity migration fails due to case differences in database columns

fields.description:
I realise that we state in CAC that you should set a confluence.home directory without spaces, however customers still regularly trip up over this and really we should try to support directories with spaces in the path.

This particular instance is a failure to import a site backup.

fields.description:
Currently the vital part of the license generation is very user-unfriendly for non-advanced users.

a) the hyperlink only applies to the word "online". That is short and barely visible. Also it looks like I will get an explanation for the term "online". The hyperlink should encompass the whole action: "You can _generate a license key instantly online_"

b) the process for creating a  license takes 5 steps for a new user. This is bad enough. The worst part is that you end up on a screen with a license, but you don't know where to paste it. for one beceause the description on that screen is wrong, for another because there is no easy way to get back. We should ask the user to open the license generation process in another window, or at least add an explanation that we suggest he does. "*You will need to return to this page after creating the license, so we suggest you open the above link in a new browser window*"
fields.summary: Improve label for license generation in Setup Wizard
Label.getUrlPath() returns bad path for team labels

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#cfc}
h3. Patch for 2.6.x, 2.7.x, 2.8.0

Place attached {{ResourceDownload.class}} in {{confluence/WEB-INF/lib/confluence-2.x.x.jar/com/atlassian/confluence/servlet/download}}
{panel}
This affects people when:
 - A custom logo is set (eg. in Administration ->  Global Logo).
 - The server has HTTP keepalives enabled (usually the case)
 - You *refresh* (eg. ctrl-r in Firefox) a page

Then the page load may hang halfway for around 15 seconds, and there may be odd visual problems as if a stylesheet is broken.

The problem is that Confluence is trying to enable browser caching, by sending the logo with a "304 Not Modified" header. Unfortunately it is also sending the image body in the response. According to [RFC2616 §10.3.5|http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec10.html#sec10.3.5] "The 304 response MUST NOT contain a message-body".  Confluence does.  This then causes varying effects:
 - If you're serving requests directly from Tomcat's HTTP connector ("Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1" in the HTTP response), everything appears fine.  Evidently Tomcat is stripping the bogus body for you:
{noformat}
jturner@psyche:~$ HEAD 'http://localhost:8081/confluence/download/userResources/logo' | grep ETag
ETag: "1207190442000"
jturner@psyche:~$ ETAG="1207190442000"
jturner@psyche:~$ echo -e "GET /confluence/download/userResources/logo HTTP/1.1\nHost: localhost:8081\nIf-None-Match: \"${ETAG}\"\n" | nc localhost 8081
HTTP/1.1 304 Not Modified
Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1
X-Confluence-Request-Time: 1207191596513
Last-Modified: Thu, 03 Apr 2008 02:40:42 GMT
ETag: "1207190442000"
Date: Thu, 03 Apr 2008 02:59:56 GMT

{noformat}
 - If you're running Tomcat behind mod_jk or mod_proxy_ajp, then the browser sees the "304 Not Modified" header, plus the body that shouldn't be there:
{noformat}jturner@psyche:~$ HEAD 'http://localhost/confluence/download/userResources/logo' | grep ETag
ETag: "1207190442000"
jturner@psyche:~$ ETAG="1207190442000"
jturner@psyche:~$ echo -e "GET /confluence/download/userResources/logo HTTP/1.1\nHost: localhost\nIf-None-Match: \"${ETAG}\"\n" | nc localhost 80
HTTP/1.1 304 Not Modified
Date: Thu, 03 Apr 2008 03:01:17 GMT
Server: Apache/2.2.3 (Ubuntu) DAV/2 mod_jk/1.2.18 mod_ssl/2.2.3 OpenSSL/0.9.8c
ETag: "1207190442000"

�PNGIHDR��a�d�IT    pHYs..........
{noformat}

By taking a TCP dump of its interactions with the server:
{noformat}
jturner@psyche:~$ sudo tcpdump -i lo -s 1500 -w port80.pcap "host localhost and port 80"
tcpdump: listening on lo, link-type EN10MB (Ethernet), capture size 1500 bytes
110 packets captured
220 packets received by filter
0 packets dropped by kernel
jturner@psyche:~$ 
{noformat}

you can see a 15s delay, and the response to the logo request will often have headers after the body content.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-11314].
  {panel}



When we create a page with certain characters, like an apostrophe, in the title, those characters show up in the URL for that page. Some of the security tools (e.g SiteMinder)  block URLs with these characters, which then make the page unreachable. For example a title of "Terry's Tasks" results in a URL like http://localhost:8080/confluence/display/spacename/Terry%27s+Tasks

Confluence should : 
 
1) Strip characters from the title when generating the URL (e.g. http://localhost:8080/confluence/display/spacename/Terrys+Tasks )

OR 

2) Prevent the creation of pages with these characters in the title.
fields.summary: URL containing punction (XSS) characters

fields.description:
One of the build failures we occassionally see is on resin and gives strange and seemingly irrelevant XML parsing errors, typically from parsing the hibernate configs. A typical error is -

{noformat}
org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: The string "--" is not permitted within comments.
{noformat}

It turns out this is due to the way Xerces is parsing XML resource being read via the resin classloader. Roughly, the XML resource is being supplied in chunks and Xerces seems to think it can sensibly parse incomplete chunks. 

Without a greater understanding of the exact problem, it would seem that potentially any changes to XML files within the confluence.jar could cause seemingly random XML parse errors in Resin.

A quick test with xerces 2.9.0 showed that this problem no longer occurs, so we should make sure the rest of the system is happy with this change and upgrade as soon as possible.
fields.summary: Upgrade xerces to latest to resolve resin XML parsing problem

fields.description:
Post processing via Spring createBean() is expensive for plugin modules

Confluence module descriptors and macro modules are now created via the Spring bean factory's {{createBean()}} method. This change in code path has been implemented so that these modules can be manipulated by bean post processors declared in the application context. Unfortunately the computation of point cut shadows that is a part of this process is fairly expensive resulting in slower application start up times.

Courses of attack:

* Optimise the pointcut matching operations
* Short circuit the pointcut shadow evaluations, make sure only the necessary bean post processors are activated when the module is created. This might be easily achieved when we start using a separate plugin Spring context.

Classes affected:

* {{com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.descriptor.CustomMacroModuleDescriptor}}
* {{com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.ConfluenceModuleDescriptorFactory}}
fields.summary: Improve Confluence startup time by avoiding Spring's createBean() post-processing

fields.description:
The Confluence install guide at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Installation+Guide currently says "Virtual Environments such as VMware are not recommended and thus not supported for clustered Confluence."

This should be clarified, probably on a new page:
- Explain which configurations, if any, are supported under VMWare or similar virtualisation. Are the Standalone and EAR/WAR under supported application servers considered supported if virtualised?
- Make recommendations on which use cases/loads have acceptable performance when using a virtualised application server
- Advise if testing shows that database cannot be virtualised due to performance impact
- Add reasons why clustering is unsupported/incompatible
- Link to any known bugs
fields.summary: Provide support and compatibility for virtualised environments

User can continue by clicking twice on the '-' which will open and close the already loaded pages and will start working properly again.

fields.description:
The "View Change" link in an email notification currently has the following format:
http://server/pages/diffpages.action?pageId=x&originalId=y

Where x is the page's id, and y is the id given to the historic version of the page.  The historic version identifies the version of the page from before the change.  That's fine.  The problem is with x.  x will always be the *current* version of the page, rather than specifically the version created by the change.


This means if I get four notifications about a modified page, then only the most recent one will have an accurate view change link.  All the other links include extra changes.

The most obvious fix is to specify the version numbers in the links rather than the page Ids.  Based on other issues about these links, that's how they used to work.
fields.summary: View Change link in email notification become inaccurate after subsequent chages

fields.description:
I've got a problem with the UTF-8 encoding, mainly when I create a link which contains a non ASCII character. 

To reproduce, I do :

* Edit a page
* In markup wiki, I add [Testé] link
* I do save changes
* I have the link in red
* I click on the link to create the page
* I put content in the newly created page
* I make save
* Go back in previous page
* The link is still in red

My configuration :

* Fedora core 8
* PostgreSQL (with UTF-8 encoding)

* Confluence 2.7.2 (but can be reproduce on 2.7.3 and 2.5.2)

fields.description:
I am unable to locate any link in the confluence user inteface that takes me to:

{{https://wikisite/users/viewuserprofile.action?username=<theusername>}} once the said user has created a personal space.

Reproduction:

Create a new user
Have a 2nd user locate this user in the people directory
have the 2nd user click on the user name in the people directory and observe they are taken to the users profile.
Have the 1st user now create a personal space
Have the 2nd user go back to the people directory, refresh the page and click on the username
Observe that the 2nd user can no longer access user 1's profile, instead they are taken to user 2's personal space.

The reason why I request this functionality to be fixed is specifically because of the "User Information Plugin" which places common user information fields into a users profile set by the system administrator unfortunately when the user creates a personal space this information is lost and cannot be located because through the people directory you can no longer access the users profile..

We would rather not block people from creating personal spaces; we feel a link to the users profile should still be available even if a personal space has been created.
fields.summary: Allow ability to view a users profile after they've created a personal space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-11285].
{panel}
Hi,

When including different characters in page names - like %, &, +, etc., the URL is generated differently.

A usual URL (including the page name) looks like this: [http://www.gigaspaces.com/wiki/display/GS6/Welcome+to+GigaSpaces]

BUT if you add a character in the page name (for example, naming a page, C++), the URL would look like this: [http://www.gigaspaces.com/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=36864161]

which is less nice-looking to say the least, and also then all URLs in the wiki aren't standard.

Is it possible to change this?

If it's been fixed in a future version, I'll be glad to know.

Thanks,
 Limor
h4. Suggestion to avoid displaying the page ID in URL (Tested and verified in Confluence 6.5.1)
 * Avoid using these special characters *+ % ? / \ & ;* in any *page title/name*
 * Avoid ending a page title/name with *any* special characters.
 ** Example of ending a page title/name *with* special characters:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
 ** Example of ending a page title/name *without* special characters:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Page names with special characters to generate regular URL

fields.description:
Newer versions of JIRA ship with an updated Seraph trusted app component which emits error messages in a new format. They have been changed so that clients can more accurately report error conditions while the protocol evolves.

We will need to do some work to upgrade to the latest versions of Seraph and properly support the new error message format

An example of a message which was rendered nicely before the changes but is raw now:

{noformat}
Errors were reported by the JIRA trusted connection.

    * APP_UNKNOWN; Unknown Application: {0}; ["confluence:9177320"]
{noformat}

The messages are still readable enough, so this issue is minor for now.

fields.description:
I have a shortcut declaration that allows me to link to bugs in our internal bug tracking system, named tswww.

The shortcut is defined as: http://tswww.edgility.com/s/lookup?number= 
With the alias set to: %s

To look up a bug, I enter the following for the shortcut:

\[1-1C42E2@tswww\]

Where the number at the beginning is the bug number.

However, since my upgrade to Confluence 2.7, the Rich Text editor removes the bug number in the markup. Everything is fine if I edit in the Wiki Markup editor, entering the link as shown above. When I transition to the Rich Text editor, the bug appears as the bug number (as expected). However, when I transition back to the Wiki Markup editor or save the page from the Rich Text editor, the link turns into the following:

\[@tswww\]

I notice that everything works correctly if I remove the alias (%s) from the shortcut link.
fields.summary: Rich Text editor loses shortcut content if shortcut link has an alias

fields.description:
I have created a user macro called bgcolor, which the user can use to highlight text. The body of the user macro looks like this:
<font style="BACKGROUND-COLOR:$param0">$body</font>

This works fine in the Wiki Markup editor -- I can highlight a specific section of a paragraph using the bgcolor macro.

However, when I transition to the Rich Text editor, all macro opening and closing tags are automatically placed on their own line. Therefore, any internal section of a paragraph which I have highlighted turns into a separate paragraph.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-11241].
  {panel}

All Plugins (bundled and from the repository) that have been disabled have an entry in table BANDANA where BANDANAKEY is plugin.manager.state.Map.
For Example if the pagetree macro had been installed but is currently disabled would be reflected in BANDANAVALUE

<map>
  <entry>
    <string>bnpparibas.confluence.pagetree</string>
    <boolean>false</boolean>
  </entry>
</map>

	It turns out that the <boolean> expression is not really evaluated. When the plugin name is present in the map it is considered as disabled. Once the plugin is enabled again the entry in this row disappears. A clarification in the naming and the map structure is suggested to reflect the actual behavior.
fields.summary: Disabled Plugins have true/false option in Database but has no effect

fields.description:
Use the below links to modify Confluence so that it picks up the local browers's TMZ for setting in that user's profile.  Don't ask me to manually set it.
-------
Hi Drew,

Confluence picks up its system time from the JVM.
Our shared hosted instance is being hosted in St.Louis in the US and hence the timezone is set to "America/Chicago" for this instance.

By default all users will have this as their timezone, though you can set it to your preferred timezone by referring to these instructions.

I hope this gives you sufficient information to carry on from here. If not, please let us know, else feel free to "Close" the ticket.

Thanks,
Gurleen
[ Show » ]
Gurleen Anand [Atlassian] - 26/Mar/08 11:12 PM Hi Drew, Confluence picks up its system time from the JVM. Our shared hosted instance is being hosted in St.Louis in the US and hence the timezone is set to "America/Chicago" for this instance. By default all users will have this as their timezone, though you can set it to your preferred timezone by referring to these instructions. I hope this gives you sufficient information to carry on from here. If not, please let us know, else feel free to "Close" the ticket. Thanks, Gurleen

Change by Gurleen Anand [Atlassian] - 26/Mar/08 11:12 PM
Resolution 		Answered [ 10 ]
Status 	Atlassian Investigating [ 10001 ] 	Resolution Suggested [ 10011 ]

[ Permlink | Edit | « Hide ]
Andrew Wolff - 27/Mar/08 05:46 AM
Assuming the user's timezone is the timezone where you host Confluence is making unjustified assumptions. You should either:

1) require the user to manually give you their preferred timezone and set in their profile - e.g. do not leave set to an assumed St Louis timezone or, preferred,

2) use javascript to return the browsers timezone, set the user's profile to that and ask to confirm with user that you are setting their preferred timezone to xxxxxx is that OK.

To simple leave it the timezone of the co-lo location causes more incorrect assumptions than correct assumptions. I provide 2 URLS below for how Javascript can return the timezone of the browser to you.

See:
http://wicket.sourceforge.net/apidocs/wicket/protocol/http/ClientProperties.html#UTC_OFFSET
or
http://forum.java.sun.com/thread.jspa?threadID=242465&messageID=885033
[ Show » ]

To simple leave it the timezone of the co-lo location causes more incorrect assumptions than correct assumptions. I provide 2 URLS below for how Javascript can return the timezone of the browser to you. See: http://wicket.sourceforge.net/apidocs/wicket/protocol/http/ClientProperties.html#UTC_OFFSET or http://forum.java.sun.com/thread.jspa?threadID=242465&messageID=885033

As this is a feature request, I would recommend you to please "Close" this ticket and create a feature request on our issue-tracker. Please state your requirement and suggestions there along with the javascript recommendations.
Please add a watch to the feature to be informed of its progress and feel free to cast your vote there to make it more popular.

Just for your reference, this is our policy regarding implementation of feature requests for our products.

I hope this addresses your concerns. If not, please let us know accordingly.

Thanks,
Gurleen
